result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leo X W Cloud

defendant.name: Cloud, Leo X W
defendant.address: N7694 Mitchell Redcloud Memorial Road, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 9, 2022 at 08:45 am.

3:23 PM Defendant Leo X W Cloud in court.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Laura Federico in court for Leo X W Cloud. 
Officer Berg is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to making contact w/ a residence in Nekoosa. Testifies to an incident that happened earlier that day. Testifies to making contact w/ Austin G. Testifies to smelling marijuana and Austin stating he smoked before coming outside. Testifies to stating other individuals weren't home, then stated they were home. Testifies to a search warrant being drafted and a search being conducted. Testifies to Preston Fletcher being searched first and what substances were found on him. Testifies to a search being conducted on Leo Cloud. Testifies to the substances being tested and the results. Testifies to identifying who the rooms belonged to. Testifies to locating a wallet w/ Preston Fletcher's ID and a rolled up dollar bill that had substances on it. Testifies to dog medications being labeled as to Leo Cloud. Testifies to what was found in the rooms. Testifies to finding jars w/ bags of marijuana in them. Testifies to drug paraphernalia that was found. Testifies to testing the marijuana that was found and the results. Witness identifies Leo Cloud in court, court recognizes. Witness identifies Preston Fletcher in court, court recognizes. 

Attorney Federico cross examines the witness. Testifies going to the residence to do a follow up from a previous incident. Testifies to making contact with Cloud when he was coming through the kitchen. Testifies to not knowing at the time where Mr. Cloud resides. Testifies to items found in the residence of Clouds. Testifies to multiple dogs being in the home. Testifies to a large amount of cash being found on Cloud. Testifies to not seeing Cloud at that residence before. Testifies to most of the items that were found were in Jardines room.
Attorney Zima gives an additional statement regarding the search that was done. 

Attorney Federico makes an argument that there isn't probable cause showing that a felony was committed by Cloud. 

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.

Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

No contact with S.J., A.G. or P.F. or their residences. Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription. $5000

No contact w/ co-defendants or their residences - SJ, AG, and PF.
